message.content: For any prime number $p > 2$ and any two distinct natural numbers $a$ and $b$ that are both less than $p$, the sums $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i + 1) a^i$ and $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i + 1) b^i$ are not congruent modulo $p$.

The theorem states that for any prime number $p > 2$, and for any distinct natural numbers $a$ and $b$ within the range $0$ to $p-1$, the polynomial expressions $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i + 1) \cdot a^i$ and $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i + 1) \cdot b^i$ are not congruent modulo $p$.
If $p$ is a prime number greater than 2, and $a$ and $b$ are distinct integers less than $p$, then the sums $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i+1) a^i$ and $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i+1) b^i$ are not congruent modulo $p$.

The theorem states that for any prime number $p > 2$ and natural numbers $a$ and $b$ within the range $\{0, 1, \ldots, p-1\}$, if $a \neq b$, then the congruence of the two sums $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i + 1) a^i$ and $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i + 1) b^i$ modulo $p$ are not equal.

For any prime number $p > 2$, and for any distinct natural numbers $a$ and $b$ within the set $\{0, 1, \ldots, p-1\}$, the polynomial sums $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i+1) a^i$ and $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i+1) b^i$ are not congruent modulo $p$.

For any prime number $p$ greater than 2, and for any distinct natural numbers $a$ and $b$ within the range $0$ to $p-1$, the sums $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i+1) \cdot a^i$ and $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i+1) \cdot b^i$ are not congruent modulo $p$.

For any prime number $p > 2$ and for any distinct natural numbers $a$ and $b$ within the range of $0$ to $p-1$, the sums $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i + 1) a^i$ and $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i + 1) b^i$ are distinct modulo $p$.

For any prime number $p > 2$, and for any distinct natural numbers $a$ and $b$ within the range $0, 1, \ldots, p-1$, the sums $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i+1) \cdot a^i$ and $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i+1) \cdot b^i$ are not congruent modulo $p$.

The theorem states that for any prime number $p > 2$, and for any distinct natural numbers $a$ and $b$ in the set $\{0, 1, \ldots, p-1\}$, the expressions $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i+1) a^i$ and $\sum_{i=0}^{p-2} (i+1) b^i$ are not congruent modulo $p$.
